x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
In LTC homes and community care, communication between staff and families is often delayed or inconsistent. Families frequently need to visit in person or make multiple calls to get updates on a resident’s condition. This becomes critical in urgent situations, such as a resident fall, where timely updates are essential.
Current communication processes can lead to: Delayed or missed updates to families Confusion and frustration for staff and families Incomplete or untracked communication logs
Additional benefit: FamConnect can provide real-time updates to families via mobile devices, reducing the need for in-person visits or repeated calls, especially during urgent incidents.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow products or capabilities used:

  • App Engine Studio – build the FamConnect application, communication tables, forms, and dashboards
  • Flow Designer – automate notifications, escalation, and reminders to staff and family members
    Service Portal / Mobile App – allow staff to log updates and families to receive updates on mobile devices
  • Performance Analytics – track response times, communication frequency, and family satisfaction metrics
  • IntegrationHub – optional integration with resident data from EHR or LTC databases
    Inbound / Outbound REST APIs – enable integration with external systems or secure family notification channels (SMS, email, push)
  • Notification & Event Management – push real-time alerts to staff and families during urgent events
  • Role-based Access Control (ACLs) – ensure only authorized staff and family members can access resident information

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Technical dependencies:

  • Resident master data and family contact information from EHR or LTC database
  • Staff directory or roster for notification routing
  • Mobile devices for staff and family access
  • Secure communication channels (email, SMS, push notifications)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Anticipated challenges:

  • Ensuring family members are properly onboarded and authenticated for privacy compliance
  • Avoiding notification overload while ensuring urgent updates are delivered promptly
  • Training staff to log updates consistently in the system
  • Integrating with multiple legacy systems that vary between LTC facilities
